intro: Collinsia tenella, commonly known as the slender checkerbloom, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or meadows. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Collinsia tenella is a perennial herb that blooms from late spring to early summer.
